articles.author: Jess Kurti
articles.title: I Volunteered At 200 Food Banks Across The U.S. Here’s What I Learned.
articles.description: I realized I had no idea how many hungry people there were all around us.
articles.content: In 2012, I was laid off from a job that I loved. Thanks to the generosity of a family friend in a city a few hours north, I was able to relocate and start over. It was hard. I was lonely, couldnt find a job, and struggled to find a place in my adopted communi… [+10432 chars]

articles.author: Olga Khazan
articles.title: Trump’s Policies Are Scaring Immigrants Away From Essential Health Programs
articles.description: A proposed rule change puts legal immigrants’ chances of staying in the U.S. at risk if they sign up for Medicaid and food stamps.
articles.content: Lourdes Juarez has lived in North Carolina since 2000, working part-time to help children with disabilities improve their motor skills. Originally from Mexico, she is now a lawful permanent resident of the U.S. with plans to apply for citizenship. After bouts… [+12146 chars]

articles.author: Rachel Layne
articles.title: Food insecurity: After a decade of recovery, Americans still go hungry
articles.description: Some 40 million people, living in every state, lack the money or resources to secure enough to eat
articles.content:
Every county in all 50 states is home to people who struggle with hunger.
Children are more likely to experience hunger than adults.
Rural counties account for 78 percent of the highest food insecurity rates.
